1. Enable Developer Options
 2. Enable USB debugging
 3. Open shell
 4. Run command:
 adb shell pm grant com.rudyii.pdnss android.permission.WRITE_SECURE_SETTINGS

This app needs your location permission in the background to enable the Trusted WiFi AP functionality. This is an Android requirement to detect trusted Wi-Fi networks. 
 

Granting permission allows you to: 

- Trust or untrust currently connected Wi-Fi access points based on their names. Denying permission disables the Trusted WiFi AP functionality. You can always revisit this prompt later to enable it.

 

Here's how your location is used: 

- In the background: This app uses your location in the background to identify nearby Wi-Fi networks and check their AP names against your trusted list. This functionality is not used for any other purpose. 
 

This app does not use your location data for advertising.
